intro: Galium × ochroleucym var. timbalii, commonly known as the Timbalai wood-sorrel, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers clustered in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
